channel.title: W3C Technical Architecture Group-relevant MDN issues
channel.description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by W3C Technical Architecture Group

item.title: [css-properties-values-api-1] Content suggestion: Document CSS Property syntax strings
item.content:encoded:
What is the new suggestion?

The CSS Values and Properties API pages reference the syntax property of @property and registerProperty, but don't describe the syntax of the syntax property itself. That can be found in the spec but the MDN docs could use a more readable description of the syntax.

Why is it important or useful?

There is currently only the most basic example of property syntax, like "<color>" and no hint that properties can be multi-valued.

This may deserve a new page, or could go on one of the CSS Values and Properties API pages. Describing syntax in readable form is hard, but hopefully something useful if not complete could be done in hours not weeks.

Other supporting information

https://drafts.css-houdini.org/css-properties-values-api/#syntax-string
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@property
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CSS/RegisterProperty
